timeline.message:
[MOB-1754] - Disable Device for all users

Email and UserID can be null. In this situation, all the users using the device token will be disabled according to the backend docks. Also ReactNative will be having seperate methods to disableAllUsers and disableSpecific users. This will enable it too.

timeline.bodyText: Hmm, this method is protected.. When would it be called with email and userId = null?
timeline.author: vbabenkoru
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1093,15 +1093,18 @@ protected void disableToken(@Nullable String email, @Nullable String userId, @No
 
     /**
      * Internal api call made from IterablePushRegistration after a registrationToken is obtained.
-     * @param token
+     * It disables device under all users with this device by default. If a emailID or userID is provided, it will disable the device for specific user.
+     * @param email Specific email this device belongs to disable
+     * @param userId Specific userId this device belongs to disable
+     * @param token The device token
      */
     protected void disableToken(@Nullable String email, @Nullable String userId, @NonNull String token, @Nullable IterableHelper.SuccessHandler onSuccess, @Nullable IterableHelper.FailureHandler onFailure) {

replies.bodyText: This will be called from ReactNativeJS SDK. I dont know the exact use case, but the Doc says that if the userID/emailID is not specified, it is programmed disable the device for all users.
replies.author: Ayyanchira

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * It disables device under all users with this device by default. If a emailID or userID is provided, it will disable the device for specific user.
          
          
            
                 * It disables the device for all users with this device by default. If `email` or `userId` is provided, it will disable the device for the specific user.

-     * @param token
+     * It disables device under all users with this device by default. If a emailID or userID is provided, it will disable the device for specific user.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @param email Specific email this device belongs to disable
          
          
            
                 * @param email User email for whom to disable the device.
